title: Leading Cybersecurity Curriculum Reform at Al Ain University
description:
Advocated for a shift from theoretical teaching to practical, hands-on learning using platforms like TryHackMe and Hack The Box.
Proposed integrating real-world labs and gamified challenges into coursework.
Collaborating with the head of cybersecurity and senior cybersecurity professors to implement reforms.

title: Custom Cybersecurity Roadmaps & University Talks
description:
Created free roadmaps guiding learners through TryHackMe, Hack The Box, and TCM Security platforms.
Delivered 4 talks at the university to 50+ colleagues, focusing on adopting practical cybersecurity learning methods.

title: Critical Security Vulnerabilities Discovery
description:
Discovered and reported a critical IDOR vulnerability in the university’s course system that exposed all students’ data.
Identified a second one that was patched before I had the chance to report it.

title: CTF Participation
description:
Participated in 42CTF (RedTeam Hacker Academy & 42 Abu Dhabi) and Cybersecurity Awareness Day 4.0 CTF (Abu Dhabi University).
Focused on exploitation, threat analysis, and security operations in timed, high-pressure settings.

title: Active Directory (AD) Home Labs
description:
Built and configured two home labs with Domain Controllers and connected VMs to simulate enterprise environments.
Focused on AD security and exploitation.

title: Diverse Virtual Machine Lab Environments (20+)
description:
Built and configured over 20 virtual machines (Linux & Windows) using VirtualBox.
Configured NAT networks to simulate internal infrastructure for testing and analysis.

title: 100+ Practical Security Challenges Completed (Red & Blue Teaming)
description: Completed over 100 hands-on security challenges covering both red teaming (offensive) and blue teaming (defensive) concepts. Participated in Splunk BOTS (Boss of the SOC) and other platforms. Authored detailed writeups for select challenges to share insights and methodologies.
